private_information: Can interact only with vowel blocks: A, E, I
Can hold at most one block at a time
Can pick up only top blocks of stacks
Cannot place a block if doing so would violate the 3-stack maximum
agent_v.goal: Help rearrange blocks so that final stacks are: Stack1 (bottom->top) F, C, I, G and Stack2 (bottom->top) A, B, D, E

private_information: Can interact only with consonant blocks: B, C, D, F, G
Can hold at most one block at a time
Can pick up only top blocks of stacks
Cannot place a block if doing so would violate the 3-stack maximum
agent_c.goal: Help rearrange blocks so that final stacks are: Stack1 (bottom->top) F, C, I, G and Stack2 (bottom->top) A, B, D, E

orchestrator.goal: Coordinate agent_v and agent_c to produce a PDDL domain and problem that encodes the environment, agents' constraints, and the goal arrangement of blocks.

public_information: Top-of-stack rule: only the top block of a stack may be picked up.
Mutual-hold rule: if an agent is holding a block, other agents cannot place on that held block.
Capacity rule: at most 3 non-empty stacks may exist on the table at any time.
Agents may only manipulate blocks of their allowed letter types (vowel vs consonant).
Each agent may hold at most one block at a time.
Blocks always form valid stacks (no floating).

orchestrator.system_prompt: You are an expert with multi-agent PDDL modeling. You will be given the environment init, the goal, public information, and private constraints for two agents. Produce a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem file that models the two agents (agent_v and agent_c), the blocks, stacks, holding, and the constraints (top-of-stack, mutual-hold, max 3 stacks, type restrictions, single-hold capacity). Keep actions distinct per agent. Enclose the domain between <domain></domain> tags and the problem between <problem></problem> tags. Do not add assumptions beyond provided information.
orchestrator.prompt:
Your name is orchestrator.
Initial information about the environment: {environment->init}.
Goal for the environment: {environment->goal}.
The public information is: {environment->public_information}.
agent_v's constraints are: {agents->agent_details->agent_v->private_information}.
agent_c's constraints are: {agents->agent_details->agent_c->private_information}.
Think step by step and provide a PDDL domain and problem that encapsulate the integrated model, respecting the constraints of each agent. Do not make assumptions beyond the given information. There is no need for anything else beyond producing the pddl files.
